title: Problem 2096_C
statement: You are the proud leader of a city in Ancient Berland. There are n^2 buildings arranged in a grid of n rows and n columns. The height of the building in row i and column j is h_{i, j}.The city is beautiful if no two adjacent by side buildings have the same height. In other words, it must satisfy the following: There does not exist a position (i, j) (1 ≤q i ≤q n, 1 ≤q j ≤q n - 1) such that h_{i, j} = h_{i, j + 1}.
